result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Fudala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: restitution and restitution surcharge is paid in full

20 days in Marquette County Jail with huber.
Electronic Montioring authorized.
Report on or before May 1, 2015 clean & sober
Consecutive to: both counts are consecutive to each other and to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Fudala

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Warrant cancelled on payment of $100 today.  Defendant to continue to pay $100/month, commencing 4/15/16.  smr

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas Fudala
Current: 21508 North Road, Eckert, CO 81418 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2016)
Prior: N1484 Ridge Rd, Montello, WI 53949

Defendant Nicholas  Fudala in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Theft 943.20(1)(a).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1 & Ct. 3.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in along with the uncharged checks that will be read-in.
Atty Gumz agrees and states that $60.00 was paid to the COC office and asks that that pay the surcharge.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 3.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in along with uncharged checks that will be read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1 Misd. Theft 943.20(1)(a) and Ct. 3:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to each other and to any other sentence.
  Report on or before May 1, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Electronic Monitoring authorized
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Surcharge = $200.00
Restitution = $515.00 + $51.50 surcharge 
    COC office to pay out Restitution.  COC office is to pay the surcharge out of the $60.00 that was paid to the COC office for Public Defender fees and that should make the Restitution paid in full.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in along with uncharged checks that will be read-in.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in June
Defendant agrees to the payment plan fee of $15.00.

  Court advises defendant of DNA Sample requirement per statute.

Defendant Nicholas  Fudala in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that there is an offer but would like the chance to speak with Atty Hendee; Atty Gumz asks the court to have this set for Monday.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to Monday.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Fudala in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.
Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Fudala in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for Prelim.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
